pullRequest.body:
---

Note: this, as well as the existing `StarAlgHom.nnnorm_apply_le` results above, actually hold in non-unital Câ‹†-algebras too, which can be proved simply by passing to the `Unitization`. I tried to implement this but ran into the issue in [this Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/weird.20type.20class.20synthesis.20error/near/421245584). So, I'll generalize that in a future PR.

Additionally, one can show that an *injective* `StarAlgHom` between Câ‹†-algebras (again, unital or non-unital) is isometric, but actually that result follows from this one after you show that the range of a homomorphism between Câ‹†-algebras is closed.

- [x] depends on: #10368
